column5: Hot off da easel  Size 30 x36  Title--Oooooh Dad  Who has'nt hung upside down to look under the bridge
Great brush work as always Terry
You just captured a moment in my life i had forgoten all about.Thanks   Paul
Thanks guys--you would'nt believe the native specks I used to catch when I was a kid from the old farm bridges
I really like that one.  Really nice
Terry can I commission you to do a painting for me, my mother died last week and I have some images of her fishing and my family fishing I would like to re create to hang in my office

My grandparents had a farm up in Shawville Que.About 1/2 mile from the farm was one of those old bridges you talk about.So narrow, that we would have to listen for cars coming down the gravel road,so we could get off the bridge before they got there. I would go and sit on that bridge with my Gramps, and he would whistle as we sat there and fished little brook trout. Ahh yes, those summer days were the best Dang, i got all misty there for a minute.

Thanks again all  Mercman--not far from Shawville (bout an hour-Ontario side) I used to fish a creek where I would drop my line between the logs of the bridge topside---catch tiny specks---they could'nt see ya that way.  man life used to be so simple and fun then.
Very nice Terrance. Great painting. Ya,hung upside down on a few myself.
I probably landed on my noodle a few times too Bri---that's why I'm so C-A-T smart
